I'm not Italian, so correct me if I'm wrong, but I've heard that one of the judges cried or something. Was it the lady at 2:51? Because I saw her quite emotional there and she then gave him a big clap at the end. I'm just curious about the judges' reactions because everyone is complaining about them not standing up and talking among each other during the performance. I personally find it a bit disrespectful when people constantly talk while someone is speaking, singing or whatever, so I'm not gonna lie and say it didn't bother me, but I don't think they meant wrong. And we should respect that in some countries is not that usual to do a standing ovation, that they may only do it in rare occasions when the performance it's unexpectedly good. I think we all agree that this was expected from Harry. Although I would have done a standing ovation over the table, to be honest lol
